channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How one attack is reshaping the fight over immigration policy
item.description: The aftermath of the D.C. attack has brought tightened security and new immigration limits from the Trump administration.
item.content:encoded: The aftermath of the D.C. attack has brought tightened security and new immigration limits from the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: West Virginia's governor on what the D.C. shooting means for his state
item.description: West Virginia Governor Patrick Morrisey discusses the D.C. shooting that targeted two Guard members from his state.
item.content:encoded: West Virginia Governor Patrick Morrisey discusses the D.C. shooting that targeted two Guard members from his state.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Robbins

item.title: A Palestinian-American teen freed from Israeli prison comes home needing urgent care
item.description: For Mohammed Ibrahim's family, this Thanksgiving was the moment they had been waiting for.
item.content:encoded: For Mohammed Ibrahim's family, this Thanksgiving was the moment they had been waiting for.
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Ukraine begins new negotiations after a sudden shakeup in Kyiv
item.description: Negotiations to end the war resume as Ukraine confronts internal turmoil and continued Russian strikes.
item.content:encoded: Negotiations to end the war resume as Ukraine confronts internal turmoil and continued Russian strikes.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: In Istanbul, Pope Leo calls for unity between the eastern and western churches
item.description: Pope Leo visits Istanbul's Blue Mosque and celebrates mass as he calls for peace and unity among Christians and Muslims.
item.content:encoded: Pope Leo visits Istanbul's Blue Mosque and celebrates mass as he calls for peace and unity among Christians and Muslims.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Why Missouri's redistricting battle matters heading into the midterms
item.description: St. Louis Public Radio's Jason Rosenbaum examines whether Missouri Republicans can legally redraw districts mid-decade simply because the state constitution doesn't prohibit it.
item.content:encoded: St. Louis Public Radio's Jason Rosenbaum examines whether Missouri Republicans can legally redraw districts mid-decade simply because the state constitution doesn't prohibit it.
item.dc:creator: Jason Rosenbaum

item.title: Indigenous leaders rewrite their history in 'Tribal Truths'
item.description: Rappahannock Chief Anne Richardson and Upper Mattaponi Chief Frank Adams talk about preserving Virginia's Indigenous history and correcting long-held myths on their podcast.
item.content:encoded: Rappahannock Chief Anne Richardson and Upper Mattaponi Chief Frank Adams talk about preserving Virginia's Indigenous history and correcting long-held myths on their podcast.
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu

item.title: Acclaimed playwright Tom Stoppard dies at 88
item.description: Tom Stoppard is remembered as a playwright whose wit and curiosity reshaped modern theater.
item.content:encoded:
Arcadia, Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead and The Coast of Utopia. He's pictured above in London in 2017.'/>

Tom Stoppard is remembered as a playwright whose wit and curiosity reshaped modern theater.

(Image credit: Justin Tallis/WPA Pool)
item.dc:creator: Tom Vitale

item.title: A breast cancer researcher at Harvard loses 1/3 of her staff amid NIH funding cuts
item.description: Amid NIH funding delays, clawbacks and uncertainty, a scientist at Harvard who studies breast cancer has lost one third of her lab employees and wonders if she can continue her research experiments.
item.content:encoded: Amid NIH funding delays, clawbacks and uncertainty, a scientist at Harvard who studies breast cancer has lost one third of her lab employees and wonders if she can continue her research experiments.
item.dc:creator: Martha Bebinger

item.title: A new animated film offers a way for kids to learn about contemporary Native culture
item.description: This Thanksgiving, a new animated film offers teachers a resource to talk about contemporary Native Americans with their students.
item.content:encoded: This Thanksgiving, a new animated film offers teachers a resource to talk about contemporary Native Americans with their students.
item.dc:creator: Kadin Mills
